theater, where he had been with his family and Denisov. He was at once shown to the best room, which D61okhov had taken for that evening. Some twenty men were gathered round a table at which D61ok- hov sat between two candles. On the table was a pile of gold and paper money, and he was keeping the bank. Rost6v had not seen him since his proposal and S6nya's refusal and felt uncomfortable at the thought of how they would meet.
